Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has water and light, showing it looking healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant without water, showing what happens to it over time (e.g., wilting).
The student can draw a plant without light, showing what happens to it over time (e.g., yellowing or wilting).
The student can include signs or labels in the drawing to show which plant has water and light and which does not.
The student can use drawings to show that plants need both water and light to live and grow.
